message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the latest data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, we examine the relationship between export growth and firm productivity in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs a new dataset on malaria in pregnancy to investigate the impact of climate change on maternal and child health outcomes in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["dataset on malaria in pregnancy"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We draw on a unique dataset of household surveys that were conducted before and after a massive earthquake in Nepal to investigate the long-term effects of disasters on household consumption and poverty.", "dataset": ["unique dataset of household surveys"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management","Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This research uses administrative data on Syrian refugee households collected by the United Nations Development Programme to study the impact of cash assistance programs on economic activities and social welfare in Jordan.", "dataset": ["administrative data on Syrian refugee households collected by the United Nations Development Programme"], "topic": ["Migration", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "Using a rich panel dataset of individual tax returns, we estimate the causal effect of debt relief granted to individuals following bankruptcy on their future labor market outcomes.", "dataset": ["rich panel dataset of individual tax returns"], "topic": ["Debt", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This book chapter draws on several complementary datasets, including survey data on children and their caregivers, school infrastructure data, and teacher information collected through classroom observations and self-reports.", "dataset": ["survey data on children and their caregivers", "school infrastructure data", "teacher information collected through classroom observations and self-reports"], "topic": ["Education", "Infrastructure", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a large, cross-country dataset on women's economic opportunities, which includes indicators such as laws governing work, access to finance, and property rights.", "dataset": ["large cross-country dataset on women's economic opportunities"], "topic": ["Gender", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using satellite data combined with ground-based meteorological information, we estimate the effect of climate variables on yields of major cereal crops in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["satellite data", "ground-based meteorological information"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses data from nationally representative household surveys that are merged with geospatial information to evaluate the extent to which transport infrastructure investments have reduced spatial income disparities in Mozambique.", "dataset": ["nationally representative household surveys", "geospatial information"], "topic": ["Transport", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We exploit a new dataset that combines information about industrial pollution sources with air quality monitoring data to estimate the causal impact of pollution on school absenteeism and educational outcomes among children in Indonesia.", "dataset": ["new dataset that combines information about industrial pollution sources with air quality monitoring data"], "topic": ["Environment", "Education"]}]
